page.title: 02Ecology
page.content: { Sullington Warren } It is an area of heathland covering 28 acres,owned by the National Trust. In the rest of the village the ground is mainly chalk,but on the Warren the ground is made of greensand,so heather and bracken grow well. The main trees are Silver Birch,Moutain Ash and Scots Pine. Wildlife on the Warren includes foxes,rabbits and badgers.There are also wood ants nests there. People like to have picnics there,and walk their dogs. Steps have been made to help prevent erosion where people climbing _the Bronze Age bowl barrows have worn the ground away.A post mill Dominating the hilltop was burned down 1919-only the axle of it remains today.
